Posts.Content: Lina999 wrote: Hello, I just had my first mammogram ten days ago and the doctors office called me a day later to schedule a second one for a better look at both breasts. Went for second mammogram appointment yesterday and ended up having several mammograms and an ultrasound which lead to a biopsy today.   I was so shocked and terrified I didn't ask many questions. Luckily I get my results tomorrow afternoon but tonight is difficult. During the ultrasound, the doctor said the spot in my left breast is either pre-cancerous or cancerous. He never used the word benign and that scares me so much. Can anyone tell me what pre-cancerous really means?  Is there any chance for benign?  Also, any suggestions at all on questions I should ask when I get my results?  I am so grateful to have found this site and to see such great support. My thoughts and prayers are with you all!  I think I need a glass of wine.  Dx 3/21/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 5/1/2014 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy results: benign vs pre-cancerous Lina999 awb

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2014 03:30AM Lina999 wrote: Marie,  I can't tell you how much I appreciate your response. 4pm tomorrow feels like an eternity but after reading posts of others I know how lucky I am to be getting results so soon. The information you provided is so helpful and helps me prepare for whatever the news will be. And deep breathes until then... And after. Thank you!!!
Posts.Title: Biopsy results: benign vs pre-cancerous Lina999 awb
